messages.content:
You are a research assistant with access to a memory system. Your task is to answer the user's question by searching and retrieving information from memory.

Instructions:
- Use memory_search to find relevant information for the question.
- Use memory_retrieve to get full document details when you need specifics.
- Use memory_capabilities to understand what the memory system offers, including available search modes, filter fields, and any extra tools.
- If extra tools are available (e.g. batch_retrieve), prefer them for efficiency — they can fetch multiple documents in one call instead of one call per document.
- Synthesize your findings into a clear, concise answer.
- IMPORTANT: For each claim in your answer, cite the supporting episode using the format [ref_id]. Every factual statement must have at least one citation.
- If you cannot find sufficient information, say so clearly.
- You have a limited number of turns and tool calls. Use them efficiently.
Are there any DNS zone transfer or propagation issues affecting service resolution?

function.name: memory_search

messages.reasoning: We need to answer: "Are there any DNS zone transfer or propagation issues affecting service resolution?" We need to search memory for relevant info. Likely internal docs about DNS issues, zone transfer, propagation, service resolution. Use memory_search with query.

{"ref_id": "cascading_failure_01_dx_037", "text": "## 2026-01-09 Daily Operations Summary

### Endpoint Performance
- /dns-query: REQUESTS req | p50: 18ms p95: 43.3ms p99: N/A | err: 0.07% (15 errors) | success: 99.93%
- /zone-transfer: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: 1360ms p99: N/A | err: 2.2% (46 errors) | success: 97.8%
- /ixfr-request: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: 1360ms p99: N/A | err: 1.0% (2 errors) | success: 99.0%
- /ttl-change: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: N/A p99: N/A | err: 0% (0 errors) | success: 100%
- /dnssec-sign: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: N/A p99: N/A | err: 0% (0 errors) | success: 100%
- /health-check: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: N/A p99: N/A | err: 0% (0 errors) | success: 100%
- /change-request: REQUESTS req | p50: N/A p95: N/A p99: N/A | err: 0% (0 errors) | success: 100%

### Infrastructure
- bind-master-01: CPU 33% | Mem 62% | Disk 73% | Conns: 1268 | Net: 82/114 Mbps
- bind-slave-02: CPU 24% | Mem 50% | Disk 55% | Conns: 1084 | Net: 62/79 Mbps
- cloud-dns-sync-01: CPU 52% | Mem 69% | Disk 48% | Conns: N/A | Net: 102/140 Mbps
- signer-01: CPU 39% | Mem 73% | Disk 60% | Conns: N/A | Net: 18/20 Mbps

### Connection Pools
- zone-transfer-pool: active 12 | idle 3 | waiting 2 | exhaustion 0 | max 20 | avg_wait 15ms
- dns-query-pool: active 25 | idle 5 | waiting 4 | exhaustion 1 | max 40 | avg_wait 20ms
- sync-controller: active 4 | idle 0 | waiting 1 | exhaustion 0 | max 10 | avg_wait 10ms
- signer-hsm: active 1 | idle 1 | waiting 0 | exhaustion 0 | max 3 | avg_wait 5ms

### CDN & Caching
- Hit rate: 88.0% | Bandwidth: 2.5 Gbps | Origin requests: 21400

### Alerts
- [WARNING] high latency on cloud-dns-sync-01: propagation_avg_s 68
- [CRITICAL] zone transfer failures on bind-master-01: tsig_failures 0
- [ERROR] DNSSEC bogus validation event: 1 event
- [INFO] health check authoritative reachability: 99.99%
- [INFO] SOA serial mismatch count: 1
- [INFO] lame delegation count: 0

### Deployments & Changes
- Migrated 16 zones; executed automated smoke tests for A/AAAA/MX/TXT parity against on-prem results
- Adjusted TTLs for mail-related records (MX and SPF) to 1800 for 9 zones; one rollback after mail vendor advised keeping 3600 for anti-spam heuristics
- Updated cloud sync controller to include zone-level locking to avoid overlapping IXFR apply tasks; queue depth reduced
- Validated zone configurations; confirmed no lame delegations; cleaned outdated glue record at registrar

### Events
- Migrated another batch of 16 zones; executed automated smoke tests for A/AAAA/MX/TXT parity against on-prem results
- Adjusted TTLs for mail-related records (MX and SPF) to 1800 for 9 zones; one rollback after mail vendor advised keeping 3600 for anti-spam heuristics
- Updated cloud sync controller to include zone-level locking to avoid overlapping IXFR apply tasks; queue depth reduced
- External validation run confirmed no lame delegations; cleaned up one outdated glue record at registrar

### On-Call
- shift handoff note: K. O'Brien. 2 pages. 8 tickets. Status: Normal; completed batch migration and documented TTL exception for mail vendor", "metadata": {"episode_type": "distractor", "theme": "dns_migration", "episode_id": "cascading_failure_01_dx_037", "timestamp": "2024-01-26T10:30:00"}}

- /dns-queries: qps_avg 20100 | qps_peak 46500 | nx_domain_pct 2.2% | servfail_pct 0.04% | udp_pct 97.1% | tcp_fallback_pct 1.3%

- /health-checks: authoritative_reachability_pct 99.99% | soa_serial_mismatch_count 0 | lame_delegation_count 0
- /change-mgmt: change_requests 5 | changes_applied 5 | changes_failed 0 | mean_time_to_apply_min 16
- /cache-behavior: resolver_cache_hit_pct 88.6% | negative_cache_hit_pct 38.9% | prefetch_enabled_pct 70.0%
- /latency: auth_response_avg_ms 17.1 | auth_response_p95_ms 40.8 | edns0_present_pct 73.5%
- /errors: format_error_count 6 | refused_count 26 | rate_limited_count 9 | truncation_tc_pct 0.4%
- /capacity: zones_total 544 | records_total 1931200 | dynamic_updates_per_hr 295
- /compliance: zonefile_lint_errors 2 | dnssec_policy_violations 0 | audit_log_gaps 0

### Infrastructure
- bind-master-01: CPU 29% | Mem 61% | Disk 72% | Conns: 1232 | Net: 74/100 Mbps
- bind-slave-02: CPU 25% | Mem 51% | Disk 55% | Conns: 1068 | Net: 65/80 Mbps
- cloud-dns-sync-01: CPU 48% | Mem 66% | Disk 47% | Conns: N/A | Net: 92/126 Mbps | Queue depth 3
- signer-01: CPU 34% | Mem 70% | Disk 59% | Conns: N/A | Net: 15/19 Mbps | HSM slot utilization 54%

### Connection Pools

(Note: Specific pool data not provided in data sheet)

### CDN & Caching
- Hit rate: 88.6% | Bandwidth: N/A | Origin requests: N/A
- Negative cache hit rate: 38.9%
- Prefetch enabled: 70.0%

### Alerts
- [INFO] DNS zone transfer success on hostname: 0
- [INFO] TTL change rollback occurred
- [INFO] Propagation delay average at 62s
- [INFO] Cache hit rate at 88.6%
- [INFO] DNSSEC signatures refreshed 109 times
- [INFO] Change requests applied successfully
- [INFO] Latency auth response average 17.1ms
- [INFO] Errors: 6 format errors, 26 refused, 9 rate-limited, 0.4% truncation
- [INFO] Capacity: 544 zones, 1,931,200 records, 295 dynamic updates/hr
- [INFO] Zonefile lint errors: 2

### Deployments & Changes
- Added 16 zones to cloud-managed DNS; completed NS delegation tests from 10 external resolvers.
- Rolled TTL standardization for 8 zones; one rollback for CDN alias due to partner requirement of 300.
- Enabled prefetch for additional resolver POPs; cache hit rate improved.
- Updated runbook to reflect cloud sync controller ownership; decommissioned old on-prem monitoring checks.

### Events
- Added 16 zones to cloud DNS; NS delegation tests completed.
- Rolled TTL standardization for 8 zones; one rollback for CDN alias.
- Enabled prefetch for resolver POPs; cache hit rate improved.
- Closed old on-prem monitoring checks; updated runbook.

### On-Call
- shift handoff note: J. Silva. 1 pages. 4 tickets. Status: Stable; migration progressing on schedule with minor TTL exception.", "metadata": {"episode_type": "distractor", "theme": "dns_migration", "episode_id": "cascading_failure_01_dx_035", "timestamp": "2024-01-26T10:30:00"}}

function.name: memory_search
function.description: Search the memory system for relevant information. Available search modes: semantic.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default: 10.

function.name: memory_retrieve
function.description: Retrieve a full document by its reference ID.

ref_id.description: The reference ID of the document to retrieve.

function.name: memory_capabilities
function.description: Get the capability manifest describing what the memory system offers.

message.reasoning:
The user asks: "Are there any DNS zone transfer or propagation issues affecting service resolution?" Need to answer based on memory data. We have daily operation summaries with zone-transfer stats and propagation metrics. Need to identify any issues.

From 2026-01-09 summary: zone-transfer errors 2.2% (46 errors) success 97.8% and alerts: [WARNING] high latency on cloud-dns-sync-01: propagation_avg_s 68, [CRITICAL] zone transfer failures on bind-master-01: tsig_failures 0 (but tsig failures 0, maybe not issue). Also [INFO] SOA serial mismatch count: 1. So there is some zone transfer errors and propagation latency.

From 2026-01-07 summary: zone-transfers axfr_success 100%, ixfr_success 99.5%, propagation_avg_s 62, p95 150, stale_answer_pct 0.2% (low). Alerts: [INFO] DNS zone transfer success on hostname: 0 (maybe no failures). Propagation delay average 62s.

From 2026-01-13: zone-transfer 240 req, p50 520ms, p95 1200ms, err 0% success 100%.

From 2026-01-15: zone-transfer N/A.

Thus answer: Yes, there were some issues on Jan 9: zone-transfer error rate 2.2% and high propagation latency (68s avg) and a SOA serial mismatch. But other days show normal operation.

Provide answer with citations.

Need to cite each claim: zone-transfer error rate, propagation avg, warnings.

Cite ref_id "cascading_failure_01_dx_037" for Jan 9 details. Also cite "cascading_failure_01_dx_035" for Jan 7 propagation avg and low stale answer.

Also maybe cite "cascading_failure_01_dx_041" for Jan 13 zero errors.

Let's retrieve Jan 13 doc for specifics.
